Package ePortfolio

Class Investment

java.lang.Object
ePortfolio.Investment
Direct Known Subclasses:
MutualFund, Stock
public abstract class Investment extends Object
Parent class for MutualFund and Stock classes, containing common attributes and methods for investments.

      Default constructor to initialize an Investment object with default values.

    • Investment

      public Investment(String symbol, String name, int quantity, double price) throws Exception
      Constructor to initialize the object attributes based on the given values.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The symbol of the investment.
      name - The name of the investment.
      quantity - The quantity of the investment.
      price - The price of the investment.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any of the values provided are invalid.

    • setBookValue

      public void setBookValue(double bookValue) throws Exception
      Setter method for book value, which sets the book value to the given amount.
      Parameters:
      bookValue - The value to set for the book value.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the provided book value is invalid or cannot be set.

    • setBookValue

      public abstract void setBookValue(int quantity, double price, boolean sellOrBuy) throws Exception
      Abstract setter method for book value, which updates the book value based on the quantity, price, and whether the operation is a buy or sell.
      Parameters:
      quantity - The number of units to buy or sell.
      price - The price per unit of the stock or mutual fund.
      sellOrBuy - A boolean value indicating whether the operation is a buy (true) or sell (false).
      Throws:
      Exception - If there is an error during the update process.

    • paymentReceived

      public abstract double paymentReceived(double price, int quantity) throws Exception
      Abstract method to calculate the payment received when selling a stock.
      Parameters:
      price - The price per unit of the stock being sold.
      quantity - The number of units of the stock being sold.
      Returns:
      The total payment received from selling the stock.
      Throws:
      Exception - If there is an error during the calculation.

    • gainOfInvestment

      public abstract double gainOfInvestment(double price, int quantity, double newBookValue) throws Exception
      Abstract method to calculate the gain of an investment when selling a stock. The calculation uses the payment received for the stock and the new book value.
      Parameters:
      price - The price per unit of the stock being sold.
      quantity - The number of units of the stock being sold.
      newBookValue - The updated book value after the transaction.
      Returns:
      The calculated gain of the investment from the sale.
      Throws:
      Exception - If there is an error in the calculation process.

    • equals

      public abstract boolean equals(Object other)
      Abstract method that should be implemented by subclasses to compare the current object with another object. The comparison should be done based on the attributes of the object.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      other - The object to be compared with the current object.
      Returns:
      true if the objects are considered equal based on their attributes, false otherwise.
